questions.question: A man presents to the emergency department unconscious and hypotensive. His ECG reveals narrow complex tachycardia. What is the next best step in management?
questions.explanation: supraventricular tachycardia (PSVT). In any unresponsive patient with acute onset tachyarrhythmias (except for atrial fibrillation) the next step in management would be to give Synchronized DC cardioversion. Incorrect Options: Options B, C & D: They are usually administered in a hemodynamically stable patient. Additionally, amiodarone is given to patients with broad QRS complex tachycardia.

questions.question: A 70-year-old man collapsed in his house and was rushed to the hospital. On arrival, his ECG tracing was as shown below. Which of the following is the best intervention for this patient?
questions.explanation: Correct Answer: C) Injection of Adrenaline 1mg IV Explanation: The ECG here is starting to show asystole and the best treatment modality is CPR and injection of Adrenaline 1mg IV. Resuscitation Steps for Asystole Options A, B, and D are incorrect.
